p: We selected a subset of 144 clinical isolates from the 321 retreatment cases to perform molecular drug resistance testing. We used a previously described multiplex polymerase chain reaction (PCR) to target the rifampicin resistance determining region of rpoB gene [ 25]. The PCR assay targets both the tuberculous and non-tuberculous Mycobacteria (MTBC and NTMs, respectively) rpoB gene, so we could also rule out the presence of non-tuberculous isolates in our study sample using the assay. The amplified rpoB gene product was confirmed by electrophoresis on a 2% agarose gel and sent for Sanger sequencing. We analyzed the resulting sequences by Staden software package [ 26] and using MTBC H37Rv rpoB gene as reference sequence.
